au.edu.federation.caliko.utils

Class Mat3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.utils.Mat3f

  • public class Mat3f
extends Object
    A custom 3x3 matrix.

    Elements of this Mat3f class are: m00 m10 m20 m01 m11 m21 m02 m12 m22

    Matrices can be considered as are column-major - although when treating them as arrays this makes no difference.

    mXX properties are publicly accessible for performance reasons.

    Version:
    0.3 - 16/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Constructor Detail

      • Mat3f

        public Mat3f()
        Default constructor - all matrix elements are set to 0.0f.

      • Mat3f

        public Mat3f(float value)
        Constructor which sets the given value across the diagonal and zeroes the rest of the matrix.

        So for example to create an identity matrix you could just call: Mat3f m = new Mat3f(1.0f).

        Parameters:
        value - The value to set across the diagonal of the constructed matrix (i.e. elements m00, m11, and m22).

      • Mat3f

        public Mat3f(float m00,
             float m01,
             float m02,
             float m10,
             float m11,
             float m12,
             float m20,
             float m21,
             float m22)
        Constructor which sets the matrix from nine floats in the order x-axis, y-axis then z-axis.
        Parameters:
        m00 - The first element of the positive X-axis.
        m01 - The second element of the positive X-axis.
        m02 - The third element of the positive X-axis.
        m10 - The first element of the positive Y-axis.
        m11 - The second element of the positive Y-axis.
        m12 - The third element of the positive Y-axis.
        m20 - The first element of the positive Z-axis.
        m21 - The second element of the positive Z-axis.
        m22 - The third element of the positive Z-axis.

      • Mat3f

        public Mat3f(Vec3f xAxis,
             Vec3f yAxis,
             Vec3f zAxis)
        Constructor which sets the matrix from the three provided axes.
        Parameters:
        xAxis - The positive X-axis to set.
        yAxis - The positive Y-axis to set.
        zAxis - The positive Z-axis to set.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • createRotationMatrix

        public static Mat3f createRotationMatrix(Vec3f referenceDirection)
        Create a rotation matrix from a given direction.

        The reference direction is aligned to the Z-Axis, and the X-Axis is generated via the genPerpendicularVectorQuuck() method. The Y-Axis is then the cross-product of those two axes.

        This method uses the Frisvad technique for generating perpendicular axes.

        Parameters:
        referenceDirection - The vector to use as the Z-Axis
        Returns:
        The created rotation matrix.
        See Also:
        Vec3f.genPerpendicularVectorQuick(Vec3f)

      • isOrthogonal

        public boolean isOrthogonal()
        Return whether this matrix consists of three orthogonal axes or not to within a cross-product of 0.01f.
        Returns:
        Whether or not this matrix is orthogonal.

      • times

        public Mat3f times(Mat3f m)
        Multiply this matrix by another matrix (in effect, combining them) and return the result as a new Mat3f.

        Neither this matrix or the provided matrix argument are modified by this process - you must assign the result to your desired combined matrix.

        To create a ModelView matrix using this method you would use viewMatrix.times(modelMatrix). To create a ModelViewProjection matrix using this method you would use projectionMatrix.times(viewMatrix).times(modelMatrix).

        Parameters:
        m - The matrix to multiply this matrix by.
        Returns:
        The resulting combined matrix.

      • times

        public Vec3f times(Vec3f source)
        Multiply a vector by this matrix and return the result as a new Vec3f.
        Parameters:
        source - The source vector to transform.
        Returns:
        The provided source vector transformed by this matrix.

      • rotateRads

        public Mat3f rotateRads(Vec3f rotationAxis,
                        float angleRads)
        Rotate this matrix by the provided angle about the specified axis.
        Parameters:
        angleRads - The angle to rotate the matrix, specified in radians.
        rotationAxis - The axis to rotate this matrix about, relative to the current configuration of this matrix.
        Returns:
        The rotated version of this matrix.
